intro: Oxytropis campestris subsp. tatrae, commonly known as the Tatra oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it is adapted to grow in rocky or gravelly soils. This subspecies is native to the Tatra Mountains and is an important component of high-altitude plant communities.
